title: Unbelievable Adventures of Italians in Russia

sources.title: Unbelievable Adventures of Italians in Russia
sources.description:
Soviet-Italian movie, filmed in 1973 by directors Eldar Ryazanov and Franco Prosperi.

A Russian emigrant died in one of the Roman hospitals. Before death, the old lady told her granddaughter Olga that all her huge fortune was hidden in Leningrad “under the lion”. This circumstance was the reason for the urgent flight to Russia of all those who, by chance or on purpose, were initiated into this secret...

IMDb rating: 7.6

Year of production: 1974

Director: Eldar Ryazanov
Screenwriter: Emil Braginsky, Eldar Ryazanov.
F. Castellano, D. Pipolo.
Composer: Carlo Rusticelli
Production Designer: Mikhail Bogdanov.

Cast: Andrei Mironov, Ninetto Davoli, Antonia Santilli, Alighiero Nosquese, Tano Cimarosa, Luigi Ballista, Evgeny Evstigneev, Olga Aroseva.

metadata.Plot: In Italy, a dying woman tells her granddaughter that she hid her treasure many years ago in Russia, in the city of Leningrad. Other people (who were around when she died) also learn about it. Thus several people arrive in Leningrad trying to find the treasure, each one for himself/herself. What's worse - the only information they have is that the treasure is under a lion - and it's in Leningrad, a city known by its numerous statues of lions. The story gets even more interesting when the soviet militia (police) learns about the whole thing and send an undercover agent...
metadata.Writer: Emil Braginskiy, Franco Castellano, Giuseppe Moccia
metadata.Actors: Andrey Mironov, Ninetto Davoli, Antonia Santilli
